text: [Applause]
so what's been going on while I've been
gone
are there ways in which we can knock
down some of the barriers that are
discouraging young people about a life
of service and if there are I want to I
want to work with them to to knock down
those barriers and and to get this next
generation in to accelerate their move
towards leadership because if that
happens I think we're gonna be just fine
and I'm being incredibly optimistic one
of the things that I learned when I was
organizing and this troop for I think a
lot of young would be do glitters you
know you show up in a neighborhood and
your initial instinct is to tell people
what they should be interested in
instead of spending the first six months
listening and finding out what they
actually are interested in and then
connecting connecting their immediate
needs to the policies that are having
influence on those areas of concern the
statistics show that people are less
likely to be involved with various
organizations in their community than
they used to be and what that means is
then people don't have some of the same
habits of being together on a common
project that they used to we become a
more individualistic society and that I
think has some spillover effects when it
comes to both political participation
but also in terms of empathy because
you're interacting with fewer people on
a regular basis
it used to be everybody kind of had the
same information and we had different
opinions about it but there were a
common baseline of facts
and that the Internet in some ways has
accelerated this sense of people having
entirely separate conversations and if
this generation is getting all of its
information through its phones that you
really don't have to confront people who
have a different opinion or have a
different experience or a different
outlook yeah you you know if you're
liberal then you're on MSNBC and
conservative you're on Fox News you're
reading Wall Street Journal or you're
reading the New York Times or you know
whatever your choices are there maybe
you're just looking at cat videos which
is funny I actually walked up to one
official and tapped him because I
recognized him been on TV and he just
put his finger up to me and said no he
can't talk to me right now and then I
saw you and I tapped you hi mr. Obama
can I please take a picture with you and
you said no and I was like what's going
on they say on TV they care about people
in a diverse don't want to talk to me
but you said no not until you tell me
your name first
[Laughter]
[Applause]
